page.title: 13CORACLEMAKER OF IRONBRIDGE
page.content: { Mr Eustace Rogers}makes{coracles down by the River Severn. Mr.Rogers' family has been making coracles for generations. The skill has been passed down from father to son. Mr.Rogers is the only coracle maker in England. As Mr.Rogers has not got a son, he is training a young man to follow him. In the past coracles have been made by men to cross the river to avoid the daily toll on the bridge. So a man would build himself a cheap small boat to cross the river. To make a coracle, first you make a hoop made from woven pieces of ash wood and paint the basic woven shape. Then add a calico cover with bitumen on the underside. The small ones cost Â£1 or Â£2, the large wooden ones are Â£80 and the large skin and fur ones cost Â£180 each.
